definition: lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
day/sky/heaven
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: We have been naive to think that it is perfectly justified.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾經天真的以爲這是天經地義的。

sentences.english: Life is a deadly struggle in which only the fittest survive.
sentences.chinese: 高松年研究生物學，知道“適者生存”是天經地義。

sentences.english: Equality between men and women is fully justified.
sentences.chinese: 男女平等實屬天經地義。

sentences.english: As a student of biology, Kao knew that "the survival of the fittest" was ordained by nature.
sentences.chinese: 高松年研究生物學，知道“適者生存”是天經地義。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
misconception/fallacy
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
double standard
requirement/necessary condition (math)
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
political correctness/politically correct
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
